{"step_by_step_thinking": "Neurocysticercosis is a parasitic infection caused by the larvae of the pork tapeworm, Taenia solium. It primarily affects the central nervous system. In the vesicular colloidal stage, the cysts become larger and show signs of degeneration. In the granular nodular stage, the cysts become more solid and show signs of inflammation.
